title: How to Remove Dried PVA Glue from Fabric

steps.title: Put rubber gloves on.
steps.content: Put rubber gloves on. These are to protect your hands from the steam.

steps.title: Find the area of the fabric where the PVA glue has dried on.
steps.content: Find the area of the fabric where the PVA glue has dried on. Get this part ready to hold in place.

steps.title: When the kettle has boiled, hold the fabric over the steam, facing the dried glue part right into the steam.
steps.content: When the kettle has boiled, hold the fabric over the steam, facing the dried glue part right into the steam . Obviously, be very careful to keep your skin out of the path of the steam.

steps.title: Leave until the glue softens and looks wet or gel-like again.
steps.content: Leave until the glue softens and looks wet or gel-like again.

steps.title: Remove from the steam.
steps.content: Remove from the steam. Gently pick the softened glue off with your fingers. It should be very easy to remove.

steps.title: Repeat as needed.
steps.content: Repeat as needed. If it's a large area, you might need to do it in several batches.
